pros: Support by supervisor and friendly co works.
cons: Nothing to complaint. Pretty good.

pros: There were some really good people there and those people encouraged growth and change!
cons: The higher ups talked about taking suggestions but really were not open to any and they had us coming in and seeing people when the world was going virtual.

pros: Benefits, flexibility, and helpful co-workers.
cons: Difficulty managing caseload and documentation.

review_title: Rewarding Work Place for Behavioral Health Professionals
job_title: Program Support Coordinator in Rosenberg, TX
pros: Rewarding work environment, paid trainings, wonderful benefits, 4 day weekends for some holidays, dependable management team, great co-workers, realistic expectations for day to day work flow, team oriented work place, flexible schedules, quality training, great place to advance in your career, supportive management team, hands on supervisors, ethical and fair Human Resource Department
cons: Constant changes in work flow, lots of hand on trainings, masks are required for full work day on campus for staff (during COVID), need to be flexible, not much face to face communication, have to be willing to use technology (ZOOM, Microsoft Teams, camera systems, etc.)

pros: Good benefits, flexibility for responsable people who really take jobs seriously.
cons: As per my experience working for various State and private companies, I cannot find anything bad with Texana. Great opportunity for a professional growth and even better to stay bc the benefits get better.

job_title: Registered Behavior Technician in Rosenberg, TX
pros:
They pay for your training. Training is very quick and not hard. You get your full 40bhours regardless of client call outside. Good full time benefits. Cheap copay.
It's good for your first job after high school if you love working with people and kids.
cons:
Management is not very nice to you if you need to call in sick. Alot of the time if you ask for an answer they will hide it from you for a very long time and never answer to hide the fact that it will not happen. Manager is rarely ever around. Clients are in poor facility for severe behavior. It is very easy for a car to hit them if no one is paying attention to the kids. 
Pay is one of the lowest in the area. 
Very highly overworked.
You may not have a say in what changes, you could try but it's not easy when you're at the bottom of the totem pole.
Not cleaned everyday there is no janitor because not able to be afforded.

pros: Good Benefits and you’ll learn in the right team
cons: Employees that are loyal are not really appreciated

pros: Senior management was super nice and helpful, and the company offers opportunities to climb up the ladder the longer you work there.
cons: None as far as I could remember.

pros: Texana Center does amazing work with children and adults with developmental disabilities or autism diagnoses. The Board Certified Behavior Analysts at Texana are extremely competent and caring. Texana helps make the lives of the people they serve better!
cons: None that I can think of!

pros: Good hours, my boss was nice, nice people to work with.
cons: low pay, can't answer your phone if there is an emergency.

job_title: Registered Behavior Technician in Rosenberg, TX
pros: They pay for you to take you RBT exam.
cons: Aggressive and very intimidating manager. Manager always had an attitude. Once you have a small slip up, they are willing to find a way to watch you and have you terminated. Don’t let the smiles in the halls fool you. The manager is the main back stabber in the whole CCA. Acts like she’s sad to terminate you but in reality is ready to terminate the next person. Not much growth in the field. And they’re all about ethics but can’t even follow an ethical code theirselves.

job_title: Early Childhood Specialist in Rosenberg, TX
pros: I was about to meet many families that I build amazing rapports with. The babies on my case load were the reason I went to work each day. Amazing team to work with and always look out for each other.
cons:
High case load which made it hard to keep track of every client. 
I know this is not Texana fault but fail to give enough session per month to families who really needed it. 
Low pay. 
Higher management ( Not directors ) never attempt to get to know employees

pros:
- Good people to work for who are very understanding about sick days, childcare, and scheduling in general.
- Good pay and an honest job in a helping profession
cons:
- Kitchen and clean up duty for psychiatric technicians 
- Facilities are cramped and the beds are usually full
- Not a lot of activities to do with the residents

job_title: Behavior Analyst II in Rosenberg, TX
pros: Amazing benefits, Fully funded attendance to state conference and one national conference (i.e., ABAI or APBA), many other BCBAs to collaborate  and discuss with, independence with no micro managing while still providing support when needed (in my department), overall best work experience I have had.
cons: From what I observed, each department is different in several ways such as work load, atmosphere/vibe, and expectations.  So while my personal experience was amazing, I can not speak for the other departments.  I worked for the Behavior Stabilization Team.

pros: Love my clients, you learn so much from them. It is a pleasure to work with IDD population if you "were born for it".
cons: They expect too much from the employee, overload of work trying to meet the "states" expectations by burning out the employee. Manage your own schedule as long as you do clocks (in/out). Great co-workers and team leaders (HCS).

review_title: Learning about the kids and helping them to be independent had always brought joy because I love taking care of others.
job_title: ABA Individual Trainer in Rosenberg, TX
pros: The best part about working at Texana was learning new things about the kids who had disabilities and taking care of them.
cons: Employees seem to have low communication skills to one another.

job_title: Vocational Habilitation Trainer in Missouri City, TX
pros: The job is rewarding teaching Special needs individuals day to day skills for living and becoming productive members of society.
cons: The pay needs to be brought up to date with being able to live in today's economy without having to supplement income with extra part time jobs..

job_title: Service Provider Supervisor in Rosenberg, TX
pros: Texana offers services to Individuals with Mental Intellectual Disabilities such as residential services and supported employment. My experience working with management, nurses and co-workers was always positive! The management was supportive and helpful when needed. Texana offered great benefits including retirement benefits. Best part of job knowing that you were helping others and working for great team!
cons: Benefits great for individual but health insurance high for family members.

job_title: Foster Care Provider in Richmond, TX
pros: Work from home and can care for my biological son.  They people we both interact with are caring and listen.  When there is a problem it is usually handled in a timely manner.
cons: No raises in 7 yrs. Sometimes there are a lot of turnovers in staff.  Paydays aren't always convenient.  We only get paid once a month.

pros: You are able to make your own schedule according to your work load. Great relationships with co workers.
cons: Pay is too low for the workload. The last supervisor i had was a micro manager. My complaints went unresolved. Other than that its a great company to work for.
